document.docAuthor: Seeman, Owen D., Lindquist, Evert E. & Husband, Robert W.
document.docTitle: Podotarsonemus zuluensis Seeman & Lindquist & Husband 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new tribe of tarsonemid mites (Trombidiformes: Heterostigmatina) parasitic on tetrigid grasshoppers (Orthoptera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new tribe of tarsonemid mites (Trombidiformes: Heterostigmatina) parasitic on tetrigid grasshoppers (Orthoptera)

figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 27. Podotarsonemus zuluensis sp. nov. larva, dorsum.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype . Adult female.
SOUTH AFRICA
, Natal, Ntumeni, D. Otte, 7 Mar. 1965 , ex probable
Pelusca
sp. ( Tetrigidae ), specimen # 1. RWH 10VIII2010 -12. In UMMZ .

Paratypes . 7 females , 1 male , 5 larvae , as follows. 4 females , 2 larvae , same data as holotype . 4 females , 1 male , 4 larvae , same data as holotype except host specimen #2. In UMMZ except 1 female , 1 larva in each of CNCI and QM.

Diagnosis. Female and male: Palps with 2 setae (1 minute); chelicerae without teeth; prodorsal plate entirely punctate; femora Iâ€“II without setae d, lÊ¹ ; tibia I seta lâ€³ short (3â€“5); genua IIâ€“III bare; tarsus II with 4 setae, seta uÊ¹Ê¹ absent; tarsus III with 5 setae, seta uÊ¹Ê¹ present; trochanter IV with seta. Female: Setae sc1 present; vestigial setae
v2
expressed as anterolateral invaginations; coxisternal plates IIIâ€“IV separated by longitudinal striae; setae h short, 5â€“ 7 long; tracheal atria separate, post-atrial sac lightly sclerotized, not punctate. Male: Genital capsule without copulatory flanges; setae h1 rudimentary, like h2 ; tibia IV with solenidion, without setae; tarsus IV rudimentary, subterminal. Male and larva: Leg I with tibia and tarsus fused. Larva: setae h1-2 and ps1-2 short, 5â€“12 long leg I without claws.
Description. ADULT FEMALE ( Fig. 25 , n = 7 measured)

Gnathosoma .
Length 36â€“45, width 40â€“41. Palps 6â€“7, with 2 setae (2â€“3 and 1 long). Cheliceral stylets 18â€“22, without teeth. Pharynx length 25â€“27, width 11â€“14. Dorsal setae ch 19â€“21, ventral setae su 13â€“19, palpcoxal setae e 6â€“8.

Idiosoma
. Length 205â€“260, width 145â€“165. Tracheal atria separate, post-atrial sac lightly sclerotized, not punctate, with two small prongs indicating separate terminal tracheae. Prodorsal plate with punctate sculpturing, 76â€“90 long, 93â€“104 wide; with 3 pairs of setae:
v 1
14â€“16, thickened, blunt, with barbs,
sc 1
11â€“14, sc2 51â€“60, and vestigial
v2
expressed as anterolateral invaginations. Distance between setae
v1-v 1
24â€“27,
v2-v2 32
â€“34, sc1-sc1 37â€“39, sc2-sc2 70â€“
81, v1
-sc 2 17â€“22. Plates C, D, EF and H with punctate sculpturing. Setae c1, d, e, f blunt, with small barbs,
c 1
13â€“15, c2 37â€“42, d 13â€“15, e 7â€“10, f 10â€“11. Distance between setae c1-c1 56â€“61, c2-c2 107â€“115,
c1-c 2
22â€“26, d-d 26â€“33, e-e 40â€“50, f-f 16â€“23. Setae h short, 5â€“7. Distance between setae h-h 22â€“25. Cupules ia , im , ih present. Setae ps attenuate> 60, distance between setae ps-ps 11â€“13. Coxisternal setae short to attenuate, 1a 13â€“19, 2a 13â€“25, 3a > 80, 3b > 45. Distance between setae 1a-1a 15â€“18, 2a-2a 31â€“39, 3a-3a 13â€“17, 3b-3b 25â€“34; alveolar vestiges of setae 1b present, 2b not evident. Coxisternal plates IIIâ€“IV separated by longitudinal striae; coxisternal plates III convex anteriorly, sometimes just overlapping posterior margin of coxisterna II.
Legs. Leg lengths: I 45 â€“46, II 41 â€“45, III 41 â€“45. Leg IV Fe-Ge length 17â€“20, Ti-Ta length 15â€“17. Leg III, femur and genu fused.

Femur I lÊ¹Ê¹ rudimentary, vÊ¹Ê¹ 18â€“24; genu I lÊ¹ 3, lÊ¹Ê¹ 2â€“3, vÊ¹ 4â€“5, vÊ¹Ê¹ 4â€“5; tibia and tarsus I fused, tibial setae d 24â€“ 33, lÊ¹ 7â€“8, lÊ¹Ê¹ 3â€“5, vÊ¹ 5â€“9, vÊ¹Ê¹ 8â€“11, solenidion Ï† 3, tarsal setae tcÊ¹ 12â€“13, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 11â€“12, pvÊ¹ 8â€“9, pvÊ¹Ê¹ 5â€“6, s spine-like, 6, solenidion Ï‰ 7â€“8.
Femur II vÊ¹Ê¹ 11â€“14; tibia II d 15â€“31, lÊ¹ 6â€“8, vÊ¹ 15â€“19, vÊ¹Ê¹ 17â€“19; tarsus II tcÊ¹ 16â€“17, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 18â€“23, pvÊ¹ 14â€“19, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5â€“6, solenidion Ï‰ 3â€“4.
Tibia III d 23â€“25, lÊ¹ 7â€“11, vÊ¹ 18â€“23, vÊ¹Ê¹ 17â€“22; tarsus III tcÊ¹ 17â€“20, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 22â€“27, pvÊ¹ 16â€“18, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5â€“6, uÊ¹Ê¹ 3â€“4.
Trochanter IV with ventral seta 10â€“13; femorogenu IV bare; tibiotarsus IV with ventral tibial seta 14â€“18 and terminal tarsal seta> 240.
ADULT MALE ( Fig. 26 , n = 1 measured)

Gnathosoma .
Damaged. Cheliceral stylets 18, without teeth. Pharynx length 27, width 10. Dorsal setae 13, ventral setae 6, palpcoxal setae 8.

Idiosoma
. Length 139, width 108. Prodorsal plate punctate, 57 long, 81 wide; with 3 pairs of barbed setae (
v1
8, sc1 6, sc2 21) and vestigial
v2 .
Distance between setae
v1-v1 25
,
v2-v2 31
, sc1-sc1 57, sc2-sc2
26, v1
-sc2 32. Plate CD punctate. Setae with small barbs, setae c1 , 8, c2 9, d 8; setae
c 1
in transverse alignment with setae c2 . Plate EF punctate, e 5, f 6. Distance between setae c1-c1 53, c2-c2 96, c1-c2 21, d-d 8, e-e 21, f-f 8. Cupules ia , im present. Genital capsule 26 long, 28 wide, bearing alveolar remnants of h1, h2 ; ventral flanges absent. Coxisternal setae small, 1a 3, 2a 8, 3a 13, 3b 10. Distance between setae 1a-1a 14, 2a-2a 36, 3a-3a 19, 3b-3b 20; setae 1a just posterior to ap1, setae 2b far posterior to ap2. Apodemes: ap2 almost reaching medially obsolete ap sj; ap5 small, extend 12 from base, not fused medially.
Legs. Leg lengths: I 36 , II 35 , III 32 , IV 21. Leg III, femur and genu separate.

Femur I, lÊ¹Ê¹ rudimentary, vÊ¹Ê¹ 12; genu I lÊ¹ 3, lÊ¹Ê¹ 3, vÊ¹ 2, vÊ¹Ê¹ 2; tibia and tarsus I fused, tibial setae d 21, lÊ¹ 3, lÊ¹Ê¹ 2, vÊ¹ 2, vÊ¹Ê¹ 5, solenidion Ï† 2, tarsal setae ftÊ¹ 9, ftÊ¹Ê¹ 8, tcÊ¹ 10, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 9, pvÊ¹ 6, pvÊ¹Ê¹ 5, s spine-like, 5, solenidion Ï‰ 6.
Femur II vÊ¹Ê¹ 13; tibia II d 15, lÊ¹ 3, vÊ¹ 12, vÊ¹Ê¹ 13; tarsus II tcÊ¹ 7, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 14, pvÊ¹ 7, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5, solenidion Ï‰ 6.
Tibia III d 14, lÊ¹ 4, vÊ¹ 10, vÊ¹Ê¹ 8; tarsus III tcÊ¹ 15, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 14, pvÊ¹ 12, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5, uÊ¹Ê¹ 3.
Trochanter IV with ventral seta 3 long; femorogenu IV bare; tibia IV solenidion Ï† 7; tarsus IV rudimentary, subterminal, with vestigial seta.
LARVA ( Fig. 27 , n = 4 measured)

Gnathosoma .
Length 36â€“44, width 39â€“46. Palps 5. Cheliceral stylets 19â€“22, without teeth. Pharynx length 20â€“26, width 10â€“12. Dorsal setae 10â€“11, ventral setae 6â€“8.

Idiosoma
. Length 190â€“195, width 115â€“120. Prodorsal plate smooth, 55 long, split in all specimens; with 3 pairs of weakly barbed setae (
v1
5â€“7, sc1 5â€“6,
sc 2
6â€“10) and vestigial
v2 .
Distance between setae
v1-v 1
13â€“25,
v2- v2 24
, sc1-sc1 59, sc2-sc2
39, v1
-sc 2 24â€“25. Plates C, D, EF punctate. Setae tapering, barbed,
c 1
8â€“10, c2 8, d 9â€“ 10, e 8â€“9, f 8. Distance between setae c1-c1 51â€“54, c2-c2 96â€“100,
c1-c 2
24â€“26, d-d 22â€“27, e-e 32â€“34, f-f 14â€“16. Plate H punctate, setae h1 short, 7â€“8, h2 ventral, 5â€“12 (unpaired
h 3
in one specimen). Distance between setae
h 1
17â€“21. Cupules ia , im , ih present. Setae ps1 fine, 8â€“10, ps2 fine, 10. Coxisternal setae 1a 4â€“5, 2a 4â€“7, 3a attenuate, 10â€“17, 3b 5â€“10. Distance between setae 1a-1a 13â€“26, 2a-2a 27â€“32, 3a-3a 34, 3b-3b 26.

Legs. Femur I, lÊ¹Ê¹ rudimentary, vÊ¹Ê¹ 7â€“10; genu I lÊ¹ 1, lÊ¹Ê¹ 1â€“2, vÊ¹ 2â€“3, vÊ¹Ê¹ 2â€“3; tibia and tarsus I fused, tibial setae d 10â€“11, lÊ¹ 2â€“3, lÊ¹Ê¹ 2, vÊ¹ 2â€“3, vÊ¹Ê¹ 5â€“6, solenidion Ï† 2â€“4, tarsal setae tcÊ¹ 7â€“8, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 8, pvÊ¹ 5, pvÊ¹Ê¹ 3â€“4, s spine-like, 5, solenidion Ï‰ 3â€“4.
Femur II vÊ¹Ê¹ 3â€“4; tibia II d 7â€“8, lÊ¹ 1â€“2, vÊ¹ 3â€“5, vÊ¹Ê¹ 9; tarsus II tcÊ¹ 4â€“7, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 9â€“10, pÊ¹ 1, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5, uÊ¹Ê¹ 1, solenidion Ï‰ 2.

subSubSection.paragraph: Tibia III d 7â€“8, lÊ¹ 2â€“3, vÊ¹ 6â€“8, vÊ¹Ê¹ 9â€“10; tarsus III tcÊ¹ 7â€“8, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 12â€“15, pÊ¹ 1, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5, uÊ¹Ê¹ 1. Leg I without claws.

Etymology. The species name
zuluensis
refers to the presence of this species in Zululand, which is now a part of KwaZulu-Natal , South Africa .

Remarks.
Podotarsonemus zuluensis
is most similar to
P. indicus
but differs by several character states as noted in the Differential diagnosis for
P. indicus
, and also detailed in the key below.
